headline: Kirkwood Pulse • November 10, 2025
overview: The Webster Groves Police Department recently recognized the heroic and life-saving actions of Sgt. Jonathan Bachmann and First Relief Officer Ian Eigelberger. While on patrol on Aug. 7, Bachmann was alerted to an unresponsive individual in a running motor vehicle inside a closed residential garage. Bachmann entered the home through an elevated window, located the victim, ventilated the garage and Downtown Kirkwood will host its annual Holiday Walk on Saturday, Nov. 22. Holiday shopping, free entertainment, and refreshments will make this day a festive way to begin the celebration of the holiday season. Kirkwood leaders have settled on a basic plan to redevelop the former site of the city’s public works department into more than 200 new housing units. The 5.9-acre site, located between Taylor and Fillmore avenues, will be developed into six, four-story multifamily housing units totaling 275,000 square feet, with both attached and detached parking. items.title: Law Firm Threatens Lawsuit Over LGBTQ+ History Month Video Shown At Middle School
items.excerpt: The Kirkwood School District received a demand letter on Oct. 30 from the Thomas More Society asserting the district violated the First Amendment rights of parents after showing a video to North Kirkwood Middle School students that acknowledges October as LGBTQ+ History Month. The Thomas More Society is a conservative Roman Catholic national interest law firm headquartered in Chicago. According

items.title: Construction Underway For New Oxford Bend Park
items.excerpt: The northeast entrance to Webster Groves is getting a makeover thanks to a partnership between Great Rivers Greenway and the city of Webster Groves. Construction is now underway on Oxford Bend Park at the intersection of Oxford Boulevard and Big Bend in Webster Groves, which is near Maplewood. items.title: Make My Day
items.excerpt: Wow, it sure doesn’t take much to get some liberals upset. My friends look forward to the Shrewsbury crime report. In fact, most of us read that report first.

items.title: Webster Holds Open House On Possible New Performance Facility
items.excerpt: The chances of a new performance facility and enhanced skatepark in Webster Groves took another step forward last week during a community open house designed to garner public feedback on the proposed project. items.title: Shrewsbury Crime Report A Must-Read
items.excerpt: I respectfully disagree with Deborah DaLay, who finds the Shrewsbury crime reports disturbing (WKT Mailbag, Oct. 24). They are one of my “must reads” each week.
